comment: He's an okay guy but wastes a lot of time with pointless stories to fill class periods. He reads everything of the powerpoints during lectures. He doesn't follow his own syllabus and grade requirements. There are 3 exams that were hard and a homework assignment. Okoye was simply not a good teacher for this class. He's completely unprofessional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is an awesome professor in the fact that he tries to keep history entertaining, but the irritating part of the class is that the powerpoints are posted online and yet you are required to attend class where he just reads the powerpoint to you. All in all, tests are pretty easy if you pay attention and he reviews questions from exam before test.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Okoye doesn't go out of his way to help his students. If you want an A in this course, prepare to do the legwork on your own. Class periods consist of him mainly reading off of the PowerPoint and doing little more. He NEVER posts grades, so if you'd like to know where you stand before finals, good luck. I highly recommend finding another prof.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Okoye wants everyone to succeed. He gives an extra credit assignment. He can be flexible with late work. His lectures are long but interesting. He has a review class before each test. You still have to read and study, the test are not straight from the review. Overall, I enjoyed this class.
Boring lectures. Definitely have to do your own leg work in learning the course. Generous on late work and does a review before tests.

This is the second time I've had Dr. Okoye as a prof.  Class time was often wasteful w/ tangents about unrelated issues.  I would rather spend class time talking about the subject and finishing on time. Grading was timely,  but feedback was minimal and didn't help with future homework.  He wasn't bad, but still not preferable over other professors.

Dr. Okoye is knowledgeable, but wastes a lot of time with pointless stories to fill class periods; I learned most of the material from the book. He requires input from the class, but often cuts people off in mid-thought. Tests were hard and he was not helpful when I met with him after class. Dr. Okoye was simply not a good teacher for this class.

Dr. Okoye is not the best KSU has to offer, but he's not terrible either. He offers a study guide for the midterm and final, and he tends to grade lightly with a curve and extra credit. However, his accent is thick and he tends to read off the powerpoints as opposed to making the lecture interesting. Take him if you need to, but not for fun.

He has a rather heavy accent that takes concentration to understand from time to time. He is funny and does go off on tangents, however I found his class to be interesting and not too difficult. It's not an easy A, but a 3000 level class shouldn't be...
Very easy. He can be hard to understand so I sat in the front row and understood everything he said. It gets boring. I didn't really have to take notes since study guides helped more. EASY A!

Okoye is a pretty cool professor. However, the class is hard to pay attention in, but still go because participation is counted. He has somewhat of a heavy accent, so I would suggest  sitting in the front of the class. The class is not hard though. He offers study guides , easy map tests, and the ppt online. There is extra credit. Still, study.
I recommend taking this class, it's not too easy or too hard. Just attend class, write down the test questions he tells you, and study the study guides and you'll do fine.

Got an A in this class - he provides study guides & a link to quizlet flashcards which are questions for the test. Attendance and participation are 100pts so be there, even if it's boring. He provided my class with a possible 20 extra credit points - take advantage of these!! They will boost you up at the end. I recommend him.

This class is an easy A if you listen to what he says in class. Half the time he literally says "test question" plus his tests comes from the quizlet notecards  for pols exams. Gives a study need, only need the book for a little. Funny guy, I recommend him

Hard to understand his accent at first but you (kind of) get used to it after a while. Goes off on completely unrelated rants/stories sometimes and generally felt like I was wasting my time in this class. I studied and made a B in the class, If you can take another professor, but he's not completely unbearable

Tough understanding his accent. pretty easy class though overall. Easy C if you don't study and don't know anything about government. Easy B if you do know government and don't study (Like me). Easy A if you study. 3 tests, 3 GEO tests and a easy project that you get a 100 if you just turn it in on time.
Amazing Professor! He lecture comes directly from the text book and is infused with real life situations. He can be hard to understand, but he is super funny! I loved every second in this class.
He is amazing!! It was the easiest A i've made in college! Just study what he says to study and write down the power points. He is a fantastic teacher.

Spent the first week of class learning to understand his heavy accent. Not an easy A, but an A is achievable if you want it. If you can understand what he  is saying then you should do fine in his class.

Easy class, nice professor and very helpful. 3 tests (dropped lowest grade) + 3 map tests + assignment (takes 30mins) + extra credit. Gives you ppts, and study notes. Go to class as he makes questions & gives you the answer (lifesavers!) Not very hard material, but know the basics. He is funny & gives a lot of helpful, personal advice so students.
He is an easy and great professor. Make sure you do the extra credit assignments though. They can really boost your grade. easy a take him.

I hated this class. He is straightforward though. You must study to pass and he gives bonus assignments. He is actually very kind and helpful. Don't slack on the geo tests! Those are easy A's. His tests aren't easy though. This class was overall okay. Nothing interesting about the content. You will be bored.
very easy class. never used the book. 3 tests 3 map tests and 1 project. all very simple. gives study guides and flash card before every test. very easy A

You don't have to buy the textbook, he posts his lectures on Ga View. 3 exams that are 100 questions each and he gives helpful study guides. He also gives 3 geography tests which are fairly easy as well. He has an accent but you can understand him if you listen! Hes Jamaican I think so its not hard to tell. Overall hes very helpful and clear.

Super clear. Long 100 questions tests but not too difficult if you study his study guides! You don't need the book even though he says you do! He has three geography tests that are easy grades if you learn them!

He is a really funny guy. He can be a bit hard to understand but you'll get use to it and it helps to sit up front. Gives study guides for the tests and is an easy class. He wants everyone to pass and cares about his students.

There were days where I did not pay attention at all but when it came time to take the test I thoroughly filled out the study guide and did really well. He really cares about teaching, and gives geography tests that REALLY boost your grade. Not a bad class!

Okoye's lectures can sometimes be a little monotonous, but he explains everything in such detail to where you WILL understand him through his thick accent. He makes real life analogies and he actually made me LOVE his class. He will also have class discussions for hours, because he is actually INTERESTED in your polical views. He's great.
If you can't do well in this class college is not for you.  He goes way out of his way to make it class everybody can get in A in.

He is a great professor. A lot of people complain about his accent. However, if you sit near the front it will be easy to understand him. He gives flash card links for the tests. STUDY THEM! The test questions are worded the same as the flash cards. He gets things graded very quickly and returned to you. Funny guy.

Attendance is not REQUIRED, but it is 20% of your grade along with participation. Use the flashcard link that he gives you for all tests and it helps a lot! 1 assignment, 3 tests, 3 map tests, and extra credit work available! I do not like American Government, but he makes it interesting. Thick accent, but he is hilarious!

Attendance was mandatory, you got a grade for coming to class and participating. He reads right off the powerpoint, totally boring. However, he gives a study guide before the test and gives you a website to study from which makes the test super easy. Tests are straight from study guide. Accent is hard to understand.

GREAT PROFESSOR! Come to class he does give out "test questions" during lectures which are helpful. He sends out study guides for every test which is exactly what is on the exam. He is funny and makes weird jokes and laughs at himself. Study the material and you will make a good grade. RECOMMEND!

Okoye can be very hard to understand but you eventually can understand him. He gives out "test questions" so write them down! Easy answers on the tests when you pay attention. Read the book, take notes, and come to class. This class also had a SI instructor so that made this class easier.
Great Professor!
Great professor, Very nice and helpful. I will definitely take him again. You should take him.

Great professor. If you go to class and take good notes you will do fine. All his tests come from lecture and textbook. He really cares about his students and wants them to understand the material. I would definetly recommend him.

He is very helpful. He does have a very strong accent that makes it hard for you to understand him at times, but he usses a power point in his lectures. I would definitely take him again. He actually cares if you learn and helps you along the way. if you study the study guide, you will get a good drade on the test.
